text: Per-Ingvar Brånemark (May 3, 1929 – December 20, 2014) was a Swedish orthopedic surgeon and research professor. He was called the "father of modern dental implantology". The Brånemark Osseointegration Center (BOC), named after its founder, was founded in 1989 in Gothenburg, Sweden. Brånemark died at the age of 85 in Gothenburg. ==References== ==Other websites== *Nobel Biocare Convention 2007 *Brånemark Osseointegration Center *Bacterial Persistence in Dentoalveolar Bone Following Extraction: A Microbiological Study and Implications for Dental Implant Treatment - Clinical Implant Dentistry and Related Research *The man who made people smile - nobelbiocare.com Category:1929 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Swedish scientists
title: Per-Ingvar Brånemark
